description.narrative: Communities affected by migration benefit from improved local services and have access to income-generating opportunities, including improved employment reintegration support for returnees.

comment.narrative:
1. The previous National Employment Strategy expired in December 2015, it has never been evaluated 2. Weak capacity of the MLSPF to assess and develop employment policies, as well as to lead the inter-ministerial coordination process on employment policy development 3. Very poor experience of MPSF in conducting public debates on employment policies 4. Lack of an institutional framework (regulations, procedures, designated staff) for supporting the reintegration of returned migrants at NEA 5. Poor capacity of NEA staff to provide adjusted reintegration services to returned migrants; 6. Lack of adjusted services, and poor data on migrants beneficiaries of NEA services 8. Migrants’ satisfaction with NEA/TEA services poorly assessed. 9. Referral sporadically and non-systemically done 10. N/A 11. None existing model at national level of fostering migrant 12.N/A 13.N/A 14.N/A 15.N/A
16. Weak diaspora engagement in local initiatives; 17.One functional association HomeTown Association in Selemet 18. Less than 50% of the target local authorities have functional webpages and social media profiles 19.N/A 20.N/A 21.N/A

1. N/A in 2018 2. Support to MHLSP in implementing provisions of the National Employment Strategy on employment data gap analysis; and submit recommendations to the Ministry for implementing improvements. 3. N/A in 2018 4. Support to NEA in the enforcing procedures and regulations for the institutionalization of reintegration focal points. 5. Capacity assessment of reintegration focal points of TEAs. 6. Advance Capacity building of NEA reintegration focal points to improve service provision, visibility and communication with returned migrants. 7. At least 1200 returned migrants benefit from NEA services. 8. N/A in 2018. 9. N/A in 2018 10.Capacity building and guidance to TEA in implementing the mechanism and referring migrants to required services, through at least one coaching session and one workshop. 11. 13 additional localities successfully tested and applied the innovative community mobilization mechanism, to ensure that every rayon from Moldova has at least one successful model. 12. 13 additional target localities improved capacities of LPAs that apply community crowdfunding for local service improvement. 13. at least 45,000 USD raised for 13 local development projects 14. 13 local strategies and action plans with the migration component integrated, approved by local councils 15. 13 local community projects implemented 16. at least 2000 additional migrants engaged in 13 new target localities. 17. 38 Hometown Associations fully functional acting as LPAs sustainable partners for local development 18. 13 additional target communities (overall 38) have capacities to plan and implement communication campaigns aimed at meaningfully engaging migrants in local development 19. At least 5 capacity building activities held, with 80 LPA and HTA representatives capacitated. 20. At least one public event held in each of 38 projects target communities, with at least 50% coverage of migrants. 21. SMS tool piloted for CALM members.

1. N/A in 2018 2. Employment data analysis performed, and report with recommendations developed and submitted to the Ministry for implementing improvements; one analytical note on labour migration developed; One workshop on employment data gaps analysis delivered for MHLSP and partner institutions (15 beneficiaries, including 12 women and 3 men); Four female representatives of MHLSP and NEA supported to take part in advanced specialised trainings on defining and measuring employment concepts and indicators, developing employment policy documents, negotiating labour agreements; Four trainings (for 7 female beneficiaries) and one peer-to-peer learning (for 5 beneficiaries, including 4 women and 1 men) for the representatives of the Labour Market Observatory of NEA and MHLSP delivered, on labour migration data analysis and research. 3. N/A in 2018 4. NEA supported in taking over the internal regulations for the activity of reintegration focal points. 5. Assessment Report of the capacity of TEA reintegration focal points developed. 6. Advanced capacity building package delivered to reintegration focal points from 35 TEAs designed to improve visibility of TEA services, communication with and services for returned migrants (four trainings and two in-country visits/workshops delivered to 137 representatives of 35 TEAs/NEA, including 123 women and 14 men). 7. A number of 1481 returned unemployed and job-seeking migrants (including 444 women and 1037 men) benefited from NEA/TEAs employment reintegration support services. 8. N/A in 2018 9. N/A in 2018 10. Capacity of 25 TEAs strengthened in implementing the referral mechanism of returned migrants, through one training (26 female representatives of 25 TEAs), guidance and support in organizing induction workshops of local teams on implementing the referral mechanism (25 workshops, or one workshop per locality). 11. 13 additional localities successfully applied the innovative community mobilisation mechanism. Up to date, each region/rayon from Moldova has at least one successful model to be scaled and replicated. Additionally 101 LPAs from Moldova supported via CALM to replicate the model. Kyrgyzstan and Serbia studied the Moldovan model and initiated its replication. 12. 13 additional target localities improved capacities of LPAs that apply community crowdfunding for local service improvement. Over 50 additional LPAs representatives benefited of dedicated training on M&D, communication, project writing, fundraising, LED, local services management, fundraising, reporting... 13. An amount of 89,500 USD raised for 14 local services development projects. 14. 13 local strategies and action plans with the migration component integrated, approved by local councils. Over 250 additional persons (including migrants consulted on local priorities, needs and solutions. 15. 26 development projects implemented in 23 municipalities throughout Moldova (14 local services; 8 LED; 4 IMC). The provided seed funding (in the amount of $610,000 co-generated local investments in the amount of 830.000 thousand, whereby achieving a 236% financial multiplication effect and reaching over $1,44 mln of total investments. The total number of beneficiaries is 127,830 persons. 16. Additionally 3700 migrants engaged in 13 new target localities. 17. 38 Hometown Associations fully functional acting as LPAs sustainable partners for local development. Additionally 101 LPAs supported via CALM to establish HTAs and engage migrants in local development projects. 18. 13 additional target communities (overall 38) have capacities to plan and implement communication campaigns aimed at meaningfully engaging migrants in local development. Overall 25 communication campaigns carried out in the 38 partner localities and promoted at through the mass-media. Over 600 appearances in the national and local media were spotted 19. 20 capacity building activities held, with 120 LPA and HTA representatives. 20. Over 200 events held in all 38 projects target communities, with the participation of migrants (60% coverage), the local population, HTAs, LPAs and CPAs 21. SMS tool undergoing negotiation with CALM and relevant national public and private stakeholders.
Finalization of the project activities and final reporting submission.
Project activities finalized and report submitted.
